```{r data generation, echo=FALSE, results='hide'}
conf <- 0.95
alpha <- 1-conf
ans <- round(qnorm(1-alpha/2, mean =0, sd =1),2)

choices <- c()

choices[1] <- qnorm(1-alpha/2, mean =0, sd =1)
choices[2] <- qnorm(1-alpha, mean =0, sd =1)
choices[3] <- qnorm(alpha/2, mean =0, sd =1)
choices[4] <- qnorm(alpha, mean = 0, sd =1)

choices <- round(choices,2)
sol <- choices==ans

```


Question
==============
For a standard normal distribution, what is the critical value for a 95% confidence interval, $Z^*$? Round solution to 2 decimal places. 

```{r questionlist, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(choices,  markup = "markdown")
```


Solution
==========
The critical value for a 95% Confidence interval can be found using:
```{r, echo=TRUE}
confidence_level <- 0.95
alpha <- 1-confidence_level
round(qnorm(1-alpha/2, mean =0, sd =1),2)

```


The correct answer is 
```{r solutionlist, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sol, markup = "markdown")
```
